results.title: How Michael B. Jordan and Jonathan Majors Fought Harmoniously
results.abstract: One’s a big name, and one’s about to be. But to get along on ‘Creed III,’ they had to let go of ego and trust each other to pull no punches.

multimedia.caption: Michael B. Jordan, right, said he worked to persuade Jonathan Majors to sign on. The co-star had his concerns: “There was nothing historically that said an actor was going to look after another Black actor.”
multimedia.copyright: Gioncarlo Valentine for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Michael B. Jordan, right, said he worked to persuade Jonathan Majors to sign on. The co-star had his concerns: “There was nothing historically that said an actor was going to look after another Black actor.”

results.title: ‘Creed III’ Review: A Franchise Finds New Fertile Ground
results.abstract: In his tender and gruff directorial debut, Michael B. Jordan again takes the lead, this time alongside Jonathan Majors as a childhood friend who has reappeared.

multimedia.caption: Michael B. Jordan reprises his role as Adonis Creed in “Creed III,” his directorial debut.
Michael B. Jordan reprises his role as Adonis Creed in “Creed III,” his directorial debut.

results.title: ‘I Don’t Take a Single Second for Granted’: Asian and Asian American Nominees on the Oscars
results.abstract: It was a record year for actors, but directors, musicians and other artists of Asian descent are also up for statuettes. We asked many of the contenders to reflect on their work.
results.byline: By Robert Ito and Justin J Wee

multimedia.caption: Hong Chau is nominated for best supporting actress for her role as Liz, the stern but kind friend of an obese teacher in “The Whale.”

results.title: Asian Actors Have Been Underrepresented at the Oscars For Decades. Here’s the History.
results.abstract: A record number of actors of Asian ancestry were recognized with Oscar nominations this year, led by Michelle Yeoh of “Everything Everywhere All at Once.” Historically, Asian stars have rarely been part of the Academy Awards.

results.title: When Clothes Fly Off, This Intimacy Coordinator Steps In
results.abstract: Jessica Steinrock’s work on intimate scenes in film has come to prominence as the entertainment industry reels from the litany of sexual abuses brought to light by the #MeToo movement.

multimedia.caption: Jessica Steinrock, the chief executive of Intimacy Directors and Coordinators, is at the vanguard of a field that facilitates the production of scenes involving nudity, simulated sex or hyper exposure.

results.title: ‘¿Será que me merezco tanto?’: Ricardo Darín y los Oscar
results.abstract: El actor ha protagonizado las cuatro películas por las que su país ha sido nominado este siglo, pero él cree que más que su talento, su mayor suerte es la confianza que otros han tenido en él.

results.title: Heads Up: A Better Movie Seat May Cost You

results.title: Tom Sizemore, Intense Actor With a Troubled Life, Dies at 61
results.abstract: He earned praise for his work in films like “Saving Private Ryan” and “Black Hawk Down.” He also served prison time for drug possession and domestic abuse.

results.title: For Sale: Memories From One of Hollywood’s Most Enduring Love Stories

results.title: Richard Anobile, Chronicler of the Marx Brothers, Dies at 76
results.abstract: He produced many books about film. But Groucho Marx tried to stop distribution of one collaborative effort because he didn’t like seeing his salty and insulting remarks in print.

multimedia.caption: Richard J. Anobile in 2022. His friendly collaboration with Groucho Marx on a project called “The Marx Bros. Scrapbook” turned sour.

results.title: Walter Mirisch, Pioneering Producer of Canonical Films, Dies at 101
results.abstract: Admired for his creative instincts, he oversaw films that won 28 Oscars, including “West Side Story,” “The Apartment” and “In the Heat of the Night.”
des_facet: In the Heat of the Night (Movie)
org_facet: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

multimedia.caption: The film producer Walter Mirisch in 1975 in Los Angeles. The Mirisch Company, which he and two brothers founded in 1957, grew to be an industry powerhouse.

results.title: A Polarizing French Philosopher Chooses War Zones Over Salons
results.abstract: In a new film, “Slava Ukraini,” the writer and filmmaker Bernard-Henri Lévy warns of a heavy price if the West fails to defeat Putin in Ukraine.

multimedia.caption: Lévy is a deeply polarizing character, mocked by some critics as a dilettante or sound bite philosopher. He appears aloof from the criticism, viewing his work as a higher calling.
